title: The Heather-Moon
author: Williamson, C. N. (Charles Norris)
snippet: From Auchencairn we turned inland to a rolling country wherethe Gray Dragon would be down one hill and halfway up another before heknew what had happened.

title: The Heather-Moon
author: Williamson, C. N. (Charles Norris)
snippet: There were hundreds of historic things to see, in every direction, if wehad had time for all: traces of the Attecott Picts; Pict forts andtombs, castles of the Middle Ages; robber caves; Convenanters'monuments; and at Balcarry, near Auchencairn, the landing-place of thesmuggler Yawkins, who was Scott's "Dirk Hatteraick."

title: The Heather-Moon
author: Williamson, C. N. (Charles Norris)
snippet: The next bit of Crockett-lore I heard was at Auchencairn in the deep,indented bay we'd reached by turning south for the coast again.
